easy.question: Who was the first President of India?
easy.explanation: Dr. Rajendra Prasad served as the first President of India from 1950 to 1962.

easy.question: In which year did India gain independence?
easy.explanation: India gained independence from British rule on August 15, 1947.

easy.question: Who is known as the 'Father of the Nation' in India?
easy.explanation: Mahatma Gandhi is known as the 'Father of the Nation' for his role in India's independence movement through non-violent methods.

easy.question: Which empire built the Taj Mahal?
easy.explanation: The Taj Mahal was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

easy.question: Which movement was started by Mahatma Gandhi in 1930?
easy.explanation: The Salt Satyagraha, also known as the Dandi March, was started by Gandhi in 1930 to protest against the British salt monopoly.

intermediate.question: Which Indian ruler established the Grand Trunk Road?
intermediate.explanation: Sher Shah Suri built the Grand Trunk Road (GT Road) in the 16th century, connecting Bengal to Peshawar.

intermediate.question: Who was the last Viceroy of India?
intermediate.explanation: Lord Mountbatten served as the last Viceroy of British India and oversaw the partition of India.

intermediate.question: Which battle marked the beginning of British rule in India?
intermediate.explanation: The Battle of Plassey in 1757 marked the beginning of British rule in India when the British East India Company defeated the Nawab of Bengal.

intermediate.question: Who founded the Mauryan Empire?
intermediate.explanation: Chandragupta Maurya founded the Mauryan Empire in 322 BCE, establishing the first major empire in ancient India.

intermediate.question: Which revolutionary was associated with the Kakori Conspiracy?
intermediate.explanation: Ram Prasad Bismil was the main leader of the Kakori Conspiracy, a train robbery that took place in 1925 to fund the revolutionary movement.

expert.question: Which Indian king stopped the advance of Alexander the Great?
expert.explanation: King Porus (Puru) fought against Alexander in the Battle of the Hydaspes in 326 BCE, which made Alexander's army refuse to advance further into India.

expert.question: Who wrote the Sanskrit text 'Arthashastra'?
expert.explanation: Chanakya (also known as Kautilya) wrote the Arthashastra, an ancient Indian treatise on statecraft, economic policy, and military strategy.

expert.question: Which Chola king conquered maritime Southeast Asia?
expert.explanation: Rajendra Chola I extended the Chola Empire to Southeast Asia, conquering parts of modern-day Indonesia, Malaysia, and Thailand.

expert.question: Which treaty formally ended the Third Anglo-Maratha War?
expert.explanation: The Treaty of Pune (1817) formally ended the Third Anglo-Maratha War and marked the end of the Maratha Empire.

expert.question: Who was the founder of the Satavahana dynasty?
expert.explanation: Simuka founded the Satavahana dynasty around 230 BCE and established their rule in the Deccan region.

easy.question: Who is known as the 'God of Cricket' in India?
easy.explanation: Sachin Tendulkar is widely regarded as the 'God of Cricket' due to his extraordinary achievements and contribution to Indian cricket.

easy.question: In which year did India win its first Cricket World Cup?
easy.explanation: India won its first Cricket World Cup in 1983 under the captaincy of Kapil Dev, defeating West Indies in the final at Lord's.

easy.question: Which sport is Saina Nehwal associated with?
easy.explanation: Saina Nehwal is a professional badminton player who has won numerous international titles and an Olympic bronze medal.

easy.question: Which Indian won the first individual Olympic medal for independent India?
easy.explanation: KD Jadhav won India's first individual Olympic medal (bronze) in wrestling at the 1952 Helsinki Olympics.

easy.question: Which team won the first Indian Premier League (IPL)?
easy.explanation: Rajasthan Royals, led by Shane Warne, won the inaugural IPL season in 2008.

intermediate.question: Who is the first Indian woman to win an Olympic silver medal?
intermediate.explanation: PV Sindhu won the silver medal in badminton at the 2016 Rio Olympics, becoming the first Indian woman to win an Olympic silver medal.

intermediate.question: Which Indian cricketer has taken the most Test wickets?
intermediate.explanation: Anil Kumble holds the record for most Test wickets by an Indian bowler with 619 wickets.

intermediate.question: Who was the first Indian to win a World Championship in Badminton?
intermediate.explanation: PV Sindhu became the first Indian to win a Badminton World Championship gold medal in 2019.

intermediate.question: Which Indian footballer has scored the most international goals?
intermediate.explanation: Sunil Chhetri is India's all-time top scorer and is among the highest international goal scorers in active football.

intermediate.question: Who is the first Indian woman to win an Asian Games gold in 400m?
intermediate.explanation: PT Usha won the gold medal in 400m at the 1986 Asian Games in Seoul.

expert.question: Who holds the record for the highest individual score in Ranji Trophy?
expert.explanation: Bhausaheb Nimbalkar holds the record with an unbeaten 443 runs for Maharashtra against Kathiawar in 1948-49.

expert.question: Which Indian chess player became the youngest Grandmaster in 2019?
expert.explanation: Gukesh D became India's youngest and the world's second-youngest Grandmaster at the age of 12 years, 7 months, and 17 days.

expert.question: Who was the first Indian to win a Grand Prix in Formula One?
expert.explanation: No Indian driver has won a Formula One Grand Prix yet. Narain Karthikeyan and Karun Chandhok are the only Indians to have raced in F1.

expert.question: Which Indian wrestler has won the most World Championship medals?
expert.explanation: Bajrang Punia has won the most World Championship medals for India in wrestling with 1 silver and 3 bronze medals.

expert.question: Who was the first Indian woman to win a medal in Paralympic Games?
expert.explanation: Deepa Malik became the first Indian woman to win a Paralympic medal when she won silver in shot put at the 2016 Rio Paralympics.

easy.question: Who is known as the king of gods in Hindu mythology?
easy.explanation: Indra is known as the king of gods (Devraj) and ruler of heaven (Swarga) in Hindu mythology.

easy.question: Who is the goddess of wealth in Hindu mythology?
easy.explanation: Goddess Lakshmi is the Hindu goddess of wealth, fortune, and prosperity.

easy.question: Which bird serves as Lord Vishnu's mount?
easy.explanation: Garuda is the mount (vahana) of Lord Vishnu and is depicted as a divine eagle-like creature.

easy.question: Who wrote the Ramayana?
easy.explanation: The original Ramayana was written by Sage Valmiki in Sanskrit.

easy.question: What weapon is Lord Shiva most associated with?
easy.explanation: The Trishul (trident) is Lord Shiva's most iconic weapon, representing the three aspects of creation, preservation, and destruction.

intermediate.question: Who was Abhimanyu's mother?
intermediate.explanation: Abhimanyu was the son of Arjuna and Subhadra, who was Lord Krishna's sister.

intermediate.question: Which demon king was a great devotee of Lord Shiva?
intermediate.explanation: Ravana was a great devotee of Lord Shiva and composed the Shiva Tandava Stotram.

intermediate.question: Who was the guru of the Pandavas?
intermediate.explanation: Dronacharya was the royal guru who taught warfare to both the Pandavas and Kauravas.

intermediate.question: Which avatar of Vishnu was born as the son of Jamadagni?
intermediate.explanation: Parashurama was born to sage Jamadagni and Renuka, and was the sixth avatar of Vishnu.

intermediate.question: Who was known as Shakuni's sister?
intermediate.explanation: Gandhari was Shakuni's sister and later became the wife of Dhritarashtra and mother of the Kauravas.

expert.question: What was the name of Arjuna's conch shell?
expert.explanation: Devadatta was the name of Arjuna's conch shell, which he blew before the start of the Kurukshetra war.

expert.question: Who was the only Kaurava to survive the Kurukshetra war?
expert.explanation: Yuyutsu was the only Kaurava to survive as he chose to fight on the Pandava side during the war.

expert.question: What was the name of Ravana's father?
expert.explanation: Ravana's father was sage Vishrava, who was the son of sage Pulastya.

expert.question: Who was the mother of Ashwathama?
expert.explanation: Kripi was the wife of Dronacharya and mother of Ashwathama. She was the sister of Kripacharya.

expert.question: What was the original name of Bhishma?
expert.explanation: Bhishma was originally named Devavrata. He got the name Bhishma after taking his terrible oath of lifelong celibacy.

easy.question: Who was the first woman Prime Minister of India?
easy.explanation: Indira Gandhi served as India's first and only female Prime Minister from 1966 to 1977 and again from 1980 until her assassination in 1984.

easy.question: How many states are there in India?
easy.explanation: India has 28 states and 8 Union Territories as of 2023.

easy.question: Who is known as the 'Iron Man of India'?
easy.explanation: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel was known as the 'Iron Man of India' for his role in uniting the princely states into the Indian Union.

easy.question: Which is the lower house of India's Parliament?
easy.explanation: The Lok Sabha is the lower house of India's bicameral Parliament.

easy.question: Who is known as the 'Father of Indian Constitution'?
easy.explanation: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar is known as the 'Father of Indian Constitution' as he was the chairman of the constitution drafting committee.

intermediate.question: What is the minimum age requirement to become the President of India?
intermediate.explanation: According to the Constitution of India, a person must be at least 35 years old to be eligible for the office of President.

intermediate.question: Which article of the Indian Constitution abolishes untouchability?
intermediate.explanation: Article 17 of the Indian Constitution abolishes untouchability and forbids its practice in any form.

intermediate.question: Who was India's first Deputy Prime Minister?
intermediate.explanation: Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel served as India's first Deputy Prime Minister from 1947 to 1950.

intermediate.question: Which state has the highest number of Lok Sabha seats?
intermediate.explanation: Uttar Pradesh has the highest number of Lok Sabha seats (80) due to its large population.

intermediate.question: What is the tenure of a Rajya Sabha member?
intermediate.explanation: Members of the Rajya Sabha are elected for a term of 6 years, with one-third of the members retiring every two years.

expert.question: Which schedule of the Indian Constitution deals with official languages?
expert.explanation: The Eighth Schedule of the Indian Constitution lists the official languages recognized by the government.

expert.question: What is the 'Zero Hour' in Parliament?
options: Time between Question Hour and regular business
expert.correctAnswer: Time between Question Hour and regular business
expert.explanation: Zero Hour is the time between Question Hour and regular business when members can raise matters of urgent public importance.

expert.question: Which amendment to the Constitution added the word 'Socialist' to the Preamble?
expert.explanation: The 42nd Amendment Act (1976) added the words 'Socialist' and 'Secular' to the Preamble of the Indian Constitution.

expert.question: What is the minimum strength required for a political party to get official recognition in Lok Sabha?
expert.explanation: A political party needs at least 10% of the total seats in the Lok Sabha to be recognized as a national party.

expert.question: Which article of the Constitution provides for the formation of new states?
expert.explanation: Article 3 of the Indian Constitution gives Parliament the power to form new states and alter existing state boundaries.

easy.question: Which was the first Indian talkie film?
easy.explanation: Alam Ara (1931) was India's first talkie film, directed by Ardeshir Irani.

easy.question: Who is known as the 'King of Bollywood'?
easy.explanation: Shah Rukh Khan is widely known as the 'King of Bollywood' or 'King Khan' due to his massive success and popularity.

easy.question: Which film won the first Filmfare Award for Best Film?
easy.explanation: Do Bigha Zamin (1953) won the first Filmfare Award for Best Film in 1954.

easy.question: Who directed 'Sholay'?
easy.explanation: Sholay (1975) was directed by Ramesh Sippy and is considered one of the greatest Indian films ever made.

easy.question: Which actress is known as the 'Dream Girl' of Bollywood?
easy.explanation: Hema Malini is known as the 'Dream Girl' of Bollywood, a title she earned after her 1977 film 'Dream Girl'.

intermediate.question: Which was India's first Oscar entry?
intermediate.explanation: Mother India (1957) was India's first submission for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film.

intermediate.question: Who composed the music for 'Pakeezah'?
intermediate.explanation: The iconic music of Pakeezah (1972) was composed by Ghulam Mohammed.

intermediate.question: Which actor has won the most Filmfare Awards for Best Actor?
intermediate.explanation: Shah Rukh Khan has won 8 Filmfare Awards for Best Actor, the highest in this category.

intermediate.question: Who was the first Indian to win an Oscar?
intermediate.explanation: Bhanu Athaiya was the first Indian to win an Oscar for Best Costume Design for 'Gandhi' (1982).

intermediate.question: Which film marked the debut of Yash Chopra as a director?
intermediate.explanation: Dhool Ka Phool (1959) was Yash Chopra's directorial debut.

expert.question: Who wrote the screenplay for 'Deewaar'?
expert.explanation: The iconic screenplay of Deewaar (1975) was written by the duo Salim Khan and Javed Akhtar.

expert.question: Which film was India's first technicolor film?
expert.explanation: Aan (1952), directed by Mehboob Khan, was India's first technicolor film.

expert.question: Who was the cinematographer of 'Guide'?
expert.explanation: Fali Mistry was the cinematographer for Guide (1965), known for its innovative camera work.

expert.question: Which was the first Indian film to be shot in CinemaScope?
expert.explanation: Kaagaz Ke Phool (1959) was the first Indian film to be shot in CinemaScope.

expert.question: Who designed the costumes for 'Mughal-e-Azam'?
expert.explanation: Makhanlal was the costume designer for Mughal-e-Azam (1960), creating its iconic royal costumes.

easy.question: Who is known as the 'Father of Indian Nuclear Program'?
easy.explanation: Dr. Homi J. Bhabha is known as the Father of Indian Nuclear Program for his pioneering contributions to nuclear physics.

easy.question: Which Indian scientist won the Nobel Prize in Physics?
easy.explanation: C.V. Raman won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1930 for his work on light scattering (Raman Effect).

easy.question: What is India's first space observatory called?
easy.explanation: Astrosat, launched in 2015, is India's first dedicated space observatory.

easy.question: Which organization is responsible for India's space program?
easy.explanation: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is responsible for India's space program.

easy.question: What was India's first satellite called?
easy.explanation: Aryabhata was India's first satellite, launched on April 19, 1975.

intermediate.question: Who discovered the Raman Effect?
intermediate.explanation: Sir C.V. Raman discovered the Raman Effect in 1928, which deals with the scattering of light.

intermediate.question: Which Indian mathematician is known for the 'Zero'?
intermediate.explanation: Brahmagupta was the first to use zero as a number and develop rules for arithmetic operations involving zero.

intermediate.question: Who is known as the father of Indian space program?
intermediate.explanation: Dr. Vikram Sarabhai is considered the father of India's space program for his pioneering work in space research.

intermediate.question: Which particles were first predicted by S.N. Bose?
intermediate.explanation: Satyendra Nath Bose's work led to the discovery of bosons, particles that follow Bose-Einstein statistics.

intermediate.question: What is the name of India's Mars Orbiter Mission?
intermediate.explanation: Mangalyaan, also known as Mars Orbiter Mission (MOM), was India's first interplanetary mission.

expert.question: Who developed the Saha Ionization Equation?
expert.explanation: Meghnad Saha developed the Saha Ionization Equation which explains the ionization states of elements in stellar atmospheres.

expert.question: Which Indian scientist worked on wireless communication before Marconi?
expert.explanation: J.C. Bose demonstrated wireless communication using microwaves in 1895, before Marconi's radio communication.

expert.question: What is the name of India's solar mission?
expert.explanation: Aditya-L1 is India's first solar mission to study the Sun's corona and solar wind.

expert.question: Who discovered cosmic rays in India?
expert.explanation: D.M. Bose discovered cosmic rays using photographic plates at high altitudes in India.

expert.question: Which Indian mathematician gave the 'cyclic method' for solving algebraic equations?
expert.explanation: Bhaskaracharya developed the cyclic method (Chakravala method) for solving indeterminate quadratic equations.
